conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to calculate areas under curves for displacement.
Car A has constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30 s. Car B starts from rest, accelerates to 40 m/s at t=20 s, then maintains 40 m/s to t=30 s.
Displacement of Car A from t=0 to t=30 s is 1200 m.
Car B's displacement from t=0 to t=20 s is 400 m (area of triangle).
Car B's displacement from t=20 to t=30 s is 400 m.
Total displacement of Car B from t=0 to t=30 s is 800 m.
At t=30 s, both cars are side by side, so displacements are equal.
Maximum distance occurs when difference in displacement is greatest.
At t=20 s, Car A's displacement is 800 m.
At t=20 s, Car B's displacement is 400 m.
Maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 400 m.
